Row.Text: This extremely long gamespeed allows for longer, equal length eras but has reduced building/unit costs to allow for more warfare throughout the game.

Set.Text: Unique Assyrian Library replacement. +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City. Also has a slot for a Great Work of Writing which, when filled, gives extra XP to trained Units.
+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City.
+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have a Uiversity.
+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City. +2[ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Free Thought[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from every Trading Post and +10% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Universities.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Workers' Faculties[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Factories increase a City's [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output by 15%. Build Factories in half the usual time.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Wealth[ENDCOLOR] converts 10% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Research[ENDCOLOR] converts 10% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] science for all specialists and for all Great Person tile improvements. Receive a tech boost each time a scientific building/Wonder is built in the Korean capital.
